component.name: AceEditor
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for ACE Editor.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/ace-editor/).]]>

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The height of ACE Editor.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"400"}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Determine if the active line of code will be highlighted or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: highlightActiveLine

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Correspond to the language being typed.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: Determine if the code will be editable or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: readOnly

attribute.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Determine if print margin will be visible or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: showPrintMargin

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: The indentation size of tab key.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"4"}-->
attribute.name: tabSize

attribute.description: Determine if the tab key will act as space characters or tab characters.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: useSoftTabs

attribute.description: Determine if the line will break when it reaches the end of the line.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: useWrapMode

attribute.description: Some predefined value on the editor.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: The width of ACE Editor.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"800"}-->
attribute.name: width

component.name: Audio
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for Audio.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/audio/).]]>

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: An additional list of attributes.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: fixedAttributes

attribute.description: Variables used by Flash player.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: flashVars

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: URL (on .ogg format) used by Audio to play.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: oggUrl

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be automatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: The height of Audio's fallback using Flash.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"30"}-->
attribute.name: swfHeight

attribute.description: URL (on .swf format) used by Audio to create a fallback player with Flash.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: swfUrl

attribute.description: The width of Audio's fallback using Flash.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"100%"}-->
attribute.name: swfWidth

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: The type of audio.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: URL used by Audio to play.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Whether or not to enable the browser's built-in autocomplete functionality for input fields.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: allowBrowserAutocomplete

attribute.description: When a `queryDelimiter` is set, trailing delimiters will automatically be stripped from the input value by default when the input node loses focus. Set this to `true` to allow trailing delimiters.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: allowTrailingDelimiter

attribute.description: Whether or not to enable in-memory caching in result sources that support it.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: enableCache

attribute.description: The mode in which the AutoComplete should operate. Can be one of these: INSERT - value '0' or OVERWRITE - value '1' In case of INSERT mode, when Editor adds a suggestion, it will be added next to the matched expression. In case of OVERWRITE mode, the suggestion will overwrite the matched expression.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: fillMode

attribute.description: Provides an array of filter functions which will filter the results. By default there is one function which provides phrase match filtering.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false}-->
attribute.name: filters

attribute.description: Node to monitor for changes, which will generate `query` events when appropriate. May be either an `<input>` or a `<textarea>`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: inputNode

attribute.description: Maximum number of results to return. A value of `0` or less will allow an unlimited number of results.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: maxResults

attribute.description: Minimum number of characters that must be entered before a `query` event will be fired. A value of `0` allows empty queries; a negative value will effectively disable all `query` events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1"}-->
attribute.name: minQueryLength

attribute.description: The default processor which will be used to process matches.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: processor

attribute.description:
Current query, or `null` if there is no current query.
The query might not be the same as the current value of the input node, both for timing reasons (due to `queryDelay`) and because when one or more `queryDelimiter` separators are in use, only the last portion of the delimited input string will be used as the query value.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: query

attribute.description:
Number of milliseconds to delay after input before triggering a `query` event. If new input occurs before this delay is over, the previous input event will be ignored and a new delay will begin.
This can be useful both to throttle queries to a remote data source and to avoid distracting the user by showing them less relevant results before they've paused their typing.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"100"}-->
attribute.name: queryDelay

attribute.description: Query delimiter string. When a delimiter is configured, the input value will be split on the delimiter, and only the last portion will be used in autocomplete queries and updated when the `query` attribute is modified.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: queryDelimiter

attribute.description:
Source request template. This can be a function that accepts a query as a parameter and returns a request string, or it can be a string containing the placeholder "{query}", which will be replaced with the actual URI-encoded query. In either case, the resulting string will be appended to the request URL when the `source` attribute is set to a remote DataSource, JSONP URL, or XHR URL (it will not be appended to YQL URLs).
While `requestTemplate` may be set to either a function or a string, it will always be returned as a function that accepts a query argument and returns a string.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: requestTemplate

attribute.description:
Array of local result filter functions. If provided, each filter will be called with two arguments when results are received: the query and an array of result objects. See the documentation for the `results` event for a list of the properties available on each result object.
Each filter is expected to return a filtered or modified version of the results array, which will then be passed on to subsequent filters, then the `resultHighlighter` function (if set), then the `resultFormatter` function (if set), and finally to subscribers to the `results` event.
If no `source` is set, result filters will not be called.
Prepackaged result filters provided by the autocomplete-filters and autocomplete-filters-accentfold modules can be used by specifying the filter name as a string, such as `'phraseMatch'` (assuming the necessary filters module is loaded).<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: resultFilters

attribute.description:
Function which will be used to format results. If provided, this function will be called with two arguments after results have been received and filtered: the query and an array of result objects. The formatter is expected to return an array of HTML strings or Node instances containing the desired HTML for each result.
See the documentation for the `results` event for a list of the properties available on each result object.
If no `source` is set, the formatter will not be called.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: resultFormatter

attribute.description:
Function which will be used to highlight results. If provided, this function will be called with two arguments after results have been received and filtered: the query and an array of filtered result objects. The highlighter is expected to return an array of highlighted result text in the form of HTML strings.
See the documentation for the `results` event for a list of the properties available on each result object.
If no `source` is set, the highlighter will not be called.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: resultHighlighter

attribute.description:
Locator that should be used to extract an array of results from a non-array response.
By default, no locator is applied, and all responses are assumed to be arrays by default. If all responses are already arrays, you don't need to define a locator.
The locator may be either a function (which will receive the raw response as an argument and must return an array) or a string representing an object path, such as "foo.bar.baz" (which would return the value of `result.foo.bar.baz` if the response is an object).
While `resultListLocator` may be set to either a function or a string, it will always be returned as a function that accepts a response argument and returns an array.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: resultListLocator

attribute.description:
Locator that should be used to extract a plain text string from a non-string result item. The resulting text value will typically be the value that ends up being inserted into an input field or textarea when the user of an autocomplete implementation selects a result.
By default, no locator is applied, and all results are assumed to be plain text strings. If all results are already plain text strings, you don't need to define a locator.
The locator may be either a function (which will receive the raw result as an argument and must return a string) or a string representing an object path, such as "foo.bar.baz" (which would return the value of `result.foo.bar.baz` if the result is an object).
While `resultTextLocator` may be set to either a function or a string, it will always be returned as a function that accepts a result argument and returns a string.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: resultTextLocator

attribute.description: Current results, or an empty array if there are no results.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: results

attribute.description: The keyboard combination which should be used to show the list with found results.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: showListKey

attribute.description: Provides an array of sorter functions which will sort the results. By default there is one function which sorts the results in ascending order.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false}-->
attribute.name: sorters

attribute.description:
Source for autocomplete results. The following source types are supported:
Array

The full array will be provided to any configured filters for each query. This is an easy way to create a fully client-side autocomplete implementation.

Example: `['first result', 'second result', 'etc']`

DataSource
A `DataSource` instance or other object that provides a DataSource-like `sendRequest` method. See the `DataSource` documentation for details.
Function

A function source will be called with the current query and a callback function as parameters, and should either return an array of results (for synchronous operation) or return nothing and pass an array of results to the provided callback (for asynchronous operation).

Example (synchronous): 

    function (query) {
        return ['foo', 'bar'];
    }

Example (async): 

    function (query, callback) {
        callback(['foo', 'bar']);
    }
Object

An object will be treated as a query hashmap. If a property on the object matches the current query, the value of that property will be used as the response.

The response is assumed to be an array of results by default. If the response is not an array, provide a `resultListLocator` to process the response and return an array.

Example: `{foo: ['foo result 1', 'foo result 2'], bar: ['bar result']}`

If the optional `autocomplete-sources` module is loaded, then the following additional source types will be supported as well:
<select> Node
You may provide a YUI Node instance wrapping a <select> element, and the options in the list will be used as results. You will also need to specify a `resultTextLocator` of 'text' or 'value', depending on what you want to use as the text of the result. Each result will be an object with the following properties:
html (String)

HTML content of the <option> element.

index (Number)

Index of the <option> element in the list.

node (Y.Node)

Node instance referring to the original <option> element.

selected (Boolean)

Whether or not this item is currently selected in the <select> list.

text (String)

Text content of the <option> element.

value (String)

Value of the <option> element.

String (JSONP URL)

If a URL with a `{callback}` placeholder is provided, it will be used to make a JSONP request. The `{query}` placeholder will be replaced with the current query, and the `{callback}` placeholder will be replaced with an internally-generated JSONP callback name. Both placeholders must appear in the URL, or the request will fail. An optional `{maxResults}` placeholder may also be provided, and will be replaced with the value of the maxResults attribute (or 1000 if the maxResults attribute is 0 or less).

The response is assumed to be an array of results by default. If the response is not an array, provide a `resultListLocator` to process the response and return an array.

The `jsonp` module must be loaded in order for JSONP URL sources to work. If the `jsonp` module is not already loaded, it will be loaded on demand if possible.

Example: `'http://example.com/search?q={query}&callback={callback}'`

String (XHR URL)

If a URL without a `{callback}` placeholder is provided, it will be used to make a same-origin XHR request. The `{query}` placeholder will be replaced with the current query. An optional `{maxResults}` placeholder may also be provided, and will be replaced with the value of the maxResults attribute (or 1000 if the maxResults attribute is 0 or less).

The response is assumed to be a JSON array of results by default. If the response is a JSON object and not an array, provide a `resultListLocator` to process the response and return an array. If the response is in some form other than JSON, you will need to use a custom DataSource instance as the source.

The `io-base` and `json-parse` modules must be loaded in order for XHR URL sources to work. If these modules are not already loaded, they will be loaded on demand if possible.

Example: `'http://example.com/search?q={query}'`

String (YQL query)

If a YQL query is provided, it will be used to make a YQL request. The `{query}` placeholder will be replaced with the current autocomplete query. This placeholder must appear in the YQL query, or the request will fail. An optional `{maxResults}` placeholder may also be provided, and will be replaced with the value of the maxResults attribute (or 1000 if the maxResults attribute is 0 or less).

The `yql` module must be loaded in order for YQL sources to work. If the `yql` module is not already loaded, it will be loaded on demand if possible.

Example: `'select * from search.suggest where query="{query}"'`

As an alternative to providing a source, you could simply listen for `query` events and handle them any way you see fit. Providing a source is optional, but will usually be simpler.
attribute.name: source

attribute.description:
May be used to force a specific source type, overriding the automatic source type detection. It should almost never be necessary to do this, but as they taught us in the Boy Scouts, one should always be prepared, so it's here if you need it. Be warned that if you set this attribute and something breaks, it's your own fault.
Supported `sourceType` values are: 'array', 'datasource', 'function', and 'object'.
If the `autocomplete-sources` module is loaded, the following additional source types are supported: 'io', 'jsonp', 'select', 'string', 'yql'<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: sourceType

attribute.description: If the `inputNode` specified at instantiation time has a `node-tokeninput` plugin attached to it, this attribute will be a reference to the `Y.Plugin.TokenInput` instance.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: tokenInput

attribute.description: Current value of the input node.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: YQL environment file URL to load when the `source` is set to a YQL query. Set this to `null` to use the default Open Data Tables environment file (http://datatables.org/alltables.env).<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: yqlEnv

attribute.description: URL protocol to use when the `source` is set to a YQL query.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"http"}-->
attribute.name: yqlProtocol

event.name: allowBrowserAutocompleteChange
event.description: Whether or not to enable the browser's built-in autocomplete functionality for input fields.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: allowTrailingDelimiterChange
event.description: When a `queryDelimiter` is set, trailing delimiters will automatically be stripped from the input value by default when the input node loses focus. Set this to `true` to allow trailing delimiters.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: enableCacheChange
event.description: Whether or not to enable in-memory caching in result sources that support it.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: fillModeChange
event.description: The mode in which the AutoComplete should operate. Can be one of these: INSERT - value '0' or OVERWRITE - value '1' In case of INSERT mode, when Editor adds a suggestion, it will be added next to the matched expression. In case of OVERWRITE mode, the suggestion will overwrite the matched expression.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: filtersChange
event.description: Provides an array of filter functions which will filter the results. By default there is one function which provides phrase match filtering.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: inputNodeChange
event.description: Node to monitor for changes, which will generate `query` events when appropriate. May be either an `<input>` or a `<textarea>`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: maxResultsChange
event.description: Maximum number of results to return. A value of `0` or less will allow an unlimited number of results.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: minQueryLengthChange
event.description: Minimum number of characters that must be entered before a `query` event will be fired. A value of `0` allows empty queries; a negative value will effectively disable all `query` events.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: processorChange
event.description: The default processor which will be used to process matches.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: queryChange
event.description:
Current query, or `null` if there is no current query.
The query might not be the same as the current value of the input node, both for timing reasons (due to `queryDelay`) and because when one or more `queryDelimiter` separators are in use, only the last portion of the delimited input string will be used as the query value.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: queryDelayChange
event.description:
Number of milliseconds to delay after input before triggering a `query` event. If new input occurs before this delay is over, the previous input event will be ignored and a new delay will begin.
This can be useful both to throttle queries to a remote data source and to avoid distracting the user by showing them less relevant results before they've paused their typing.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: queryDelimiterChange
event.description: Query delimiter string. When a delimiter is configured, the input value will be split on the delimiter, and only the last portion will be used in autocomplete queries and updated when the `query` attribute is modified.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

Source request template. This can be a function that accepts a query as a parameter and returns a request string, or it can be a string containing the placeholder "{query}", which will be replaced with the actual URI-encoded query. In either case, the resulting string will be appended to the request URL when the `source` attribute is set to a remote DataSource, JSONP URL, or XHR URL (it will not be appended to YQL URLs).
While `requestTemplate` may be set to either a function or a string, it will always be returned as a function that accepts a query argument and returns a string.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

Function which will be used to highlight results. The highlighter is expected to return an array of highlighted result text in the form of HTML strings.

By default, no locator is applied, and all results are assumed to be plain text strings. If all results are already plain text strings, you don't need to define a locator.
The locator may be either a function (which will receive the raw result as an argument and must return a string) or a string representing an object path, such as "foo.bar.baz" (which would return the value of `result.foo.bar.baz` if the result is an object).

event.description: Current results, or an empty array if there are no results.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: showListKeyChange
event.description: The keyboard combination which should be used to show the list with found results.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: sortersChange
event.description: Provides an array of sorter functions which will sort the results. By default there is one function which sorts the results in ascending order.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: sourceTypeChange
event.description:
May be used to force a specific source type, overriding the automatic source type detection. It should almost never be necessary to do this, but as they taught us in the Boy Scouts, one should always be prepared, so it's here if you need it. Be warned that if you set this attribute and something breaks, it's your own fault.

If the `autocomplete-sources` module is loaded, the following additional source types are supported: 'io', 'jsonp', 'select', 'string', 'yql'<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: tokenInputChange
event.description: If the `inputNode` specified at instantiation time has a `node-tokeninput` plugin attached to it, this attribute will be a reference to the `Y.Plugin.TokenInput` instance.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: valueChange
event.description: Current value of the input node.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: yqlEnvChange
event.description: YQL environment file URL to load when the `source` is set to a YQL query. Set this to `null` to use the default Open Data Tables environment file (http://datatables.org/alltables.env).<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: yqlProtocolChange
event.description: URL protocol to use when the `source` is set to a YQL query.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description: If `true`, the first item in the list will be activated by default when the list is initially displayed and when results change.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: activateFirstItem

attribute.description: Item that's currently active, if any. When the user presses enter, this is the item that will be selected.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: activeItem

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: If `true`, the list will remain visible even when there are no results to display.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: alwaysShowList

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: If `true`, keyboard navigation will wrap around to the opposite end of the list when navigating past the first or last item.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: circular

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.name: zIndex

event.name: activateFirstItemChange
event.description: If `true`, the first item in the list will be activated by default when the list is initially displayed and when results change.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: activeItemChange
event.description: Item that's currently active, if any. When the user presses enter, this is the item that will be selected.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alwaysShowListChange
event.description: If `true`, the list will remain visible even when there are no results to display.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: circularChange
event.description: If `true`, keyboard navigation will wrap around to the opposite end of the list when navigating past the first or last item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: ButtonItem
component.description:
• Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • An optional icon or label
  • Managed user interaction states (default, active, hover)
  • Keyboard accessible
    • Quick Example:
    var instance = new A.ButtonItem({
	icon: 'gear',
label: 'Configuration'
}).render();
    Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ButtonItem.]]>

attribute.description: Whether to track the active state of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: activeState

attribute.description: An object map of the CSS class names to use for the different interaction states.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: classNames

attribute.description: Whether to apply the default interaction state to the button<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: defaultState

attribute.description: Number representing the depth of this Widget relative to the root Widget in the object heirarchy.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"-1"}-->
attribute.name: depth

attribute.description: An event callback to handle when a user interacts with the button. This can either be a function that will be attached on click, or an object map that accepts the following keys: {fn: // The function to execute context: // The context to execute the function in type: // The type of event to listen for (defaults to "click") }
attribute.name: handler

attribute.description: Whether to track the hover interaction state of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: hoverState

attribute.description: The icon to use inside of the button. Possible values are:<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: icon

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the icon of the ButtonItem. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-button-icon.
attribute.name: iconNode

attribute.description: Number representing the Widget's ordinal position in its parent Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: index

attribute.description: Text to use inside of the button.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the text of the ButtonItem. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-button-label.
attribute.name: labelNode

attribute.description: Retrieves the parent of the Widget in the object hierarchy.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: parent

attribute.description: Returns the root Widget in the object hierarchy. If the ROOT_TYPE property is set, the search for the root Widget will be constrained to parent Widgets of the specified type.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: root

attribute.description: Number indicating if the Widget is selected. attribute.name: selected

event.name: parentChange
event.description: Retrieves the parent of the Widget in the object hierarchy.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: rootChange
event.description: Returns the root Widget in the object hierarchy. If the ROOT_TYPE property is set, the search for the root Widget will be constrained to parent Widgets of the specified type.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: selectedChange
event.description: Number indicating if the Widget is selected. Possible values are: <dl> <dt>0</dt> <dd>(Default) Not selected</dd> <dt>1</dt> <dd>Fully selected</dd> <dt>2</dt> <dd>Partially selected</dd> </dl><!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: titleChange
event.description: Text to use as the title attribute of the button.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: typeChange
event.description: Button type.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description: To use a button<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: button

attribute.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.
attribute.name: dataSource

attribute.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.
attribute.name: dataSourceType

attribute.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: delimChar

attribute.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"click"}-->
attribute.name: editEvent

attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.
attribute.name: forceSelection

attribute.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: input

attribute.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: matchKey

attribute.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1"}-->
attribute.name: minQueryLength

attribute.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.2"}-->
attribute.name: queryDelay

attribute.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.5"}-->
attribute.name: queryInterval

attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.
attribute.name: queryMatchCase

attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.
attribute.name: queryMatchContains

attribute.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.
attribute.name: queryQuestionMark

attribute.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.
attribute.name: schema

attribute.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.
attribute.name: schemaType

attribute.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: suppressInputUpdate

attribute.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.
attribute.name: typeAhead

attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.
attribute.name: typeAheadDelay

attribute.description: The unique ID of the input element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: uniqueName

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: Cancel auto hide delay if the user interact with the Overlay (focus, click, mouseover)<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: cancellableHide

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: OverlayContext allow multiple elements to be the trigger, the currentNode stores the current active one.
attribute.name: currentNode

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: Number of milliseconds after the hide method is invoked to hide the OverlayContext.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: hideDelay

attribute.description: The event which is responsible to hide the OverlayContext.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"mouseout"}-->
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: If true the instance is registered on the OverlayContextManager static class and will be hide when the user click on document.
attribute.name: hideOnDocumentClick

attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: preventOverlap

attribute.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether or not a shim should be added to the Widgets boundingBox, to protect it from select box bleedthrough.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: shim

attribute.description: Number of milliseconds after the show method is invoked to show the OverlayContext.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: showDelay

attribute.description: The event which is responsible to show the OverlayContext.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"mouseover"}-->
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: Node, NodeList or Selector which will be used as trigger elements to show or hide the OverlayContext.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: trigger

attribute.description: True if Overlay should use ARIA plugin<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: If true the OverlayContext is visible by default after the render phase. Inherited from Overlay.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: Page X co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: Page XY co-ordinate pair for the widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: xy

attribute.description: Page Y co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: The z-index to apply to the Widgets boundingBox. Non-numerical values for zIndex will be converted to 0<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: zIndex

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange

event.name: fillHeightChange
event.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: focusOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

event.name: focusedChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: footerContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: headerContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: heightChange
event.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: hideOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
