component.name: DatePickerSelect
component.description:
A base class for DatePickerSelect, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Select a date from Calendar to select elements
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.DatePickerSelect({
 srcNode: '#srcNodeId',
 calendar: {
     // locale: 'pt-br',
     dateFormat: '%m/%d/%y',
     yearRange: [ 1970, 2009 ]
	}
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for DatePickerSelect.]]>

attribute.description: The order the selects elements are appended to the srcNode.
attribute.name: appendOrder

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the button of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-buttonitem.
attribute.name: buttonNode

attribute.description: Calendar configuration Object.
attribute.name: calendar

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the day of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.
attribute.name: dayNode

attribute.description: Name attribute used on the dayNode.
attribute.name: dayNodeName

attribute.description: Current locale<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the month of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.
attribute.name: monthNode

attribute.description: Name attribute used on the monthNode.
attribute.name: monthNodeName

attribute.description: If true the select element for the day will be nullable<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: nullableDay

attribute.description: If true the select element for the month will be nullable<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: nullableMonth

attribute.description: If true the select element for the year will be nullable<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: nullableYear

attribute.description: If true the select element for the days will be automatic populated.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: populateDay

attribute.description: If true the select element for the month will be automatic populated.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: populateMonth

attribute.description: If true the select element for the year will be automatic populated.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: populateYear

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the selects of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-select-wrapper.
attribute.name: selectWrapperNode

attribute.description: Trigger element to open the calendar. Inherited from OverlayContext.
attribute.name: trigger

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the year of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.
attribute.name: yearNode

attribute.description: Name attribute used on the yearNode.
attribute.name: yearNodeName

attribute.description: Year range to be displayed on the year select element. By default it displays from -10 to +10 years from the current year.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: yearRange

event.name: populateDayChange

event.name: populateMonthChange
event.description: If true the select element for the month will be automatic populated.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: populateYearChange

event.name: selectWrapperNodeChange
event.description: DOM Node to display the selects of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-select-wrapper.

event.name: triggerChange
event.description: Trigger element to open the calendar. Inherited from OverlayContext.

event.name: yearNodeChange
event.description: DOM Node to display the year of the DatePickerSelect. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-datepicker-year.

event.name: yearNodeNameChange
event.description: Name attribute used on the yearNode.

event.name: yearRangeChange
event.description: Year range to be displayed on the year select element. By default it displays from -10 to +10 years from the current year.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: DelayedTask
component.description:
• Executes the supplied function in the context of the supplied object 'when' milliseconds later
    • Quick Example:
    var delayed = new A.DelayedTask({
	 function() {
    // This callback will be executed when the DelayedTask be invoked
	 },
	 scope
 });

	// executes after 1000ms the callback
 delayed.delay(1000);
    Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for DelayedTask.]]>

component.name: DiagramBuilder
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for Diagram Builder.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/diagram-builder/).]]>

Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: builderChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: connectorsChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: fillHeightChange
event.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: builder

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: constrain

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: builderChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: connectorsChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: fillHeightChange
event.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: Editable
component.description:
A base class for Editable, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Edit in place elements
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Editable({
  node: '#editor'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Editable.]]>

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description:
Determine the content of Modal's body section.
Temporary fix for widget-stdmod bug when bodyContent initializes empty. this._currFillNode is never updated if _uiSetFillHeight is not called.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: Determine if Modal should be destroyed when hidden.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyOnHide

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description:
Determine the content of Modal's body section.
Temporary fix for widget-stdmod bug when bodyContent initializes empty. this._currFillNode is never updated if _uiSetFillHeight is not called.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange

component.name: HTML5
component.description:
An object that encapsulates util methods for HTML5 shiving.

What is a "shiv"?

To the world, a shiv is a slang term for a sharp object used as a knife-like weapon. To Internet Explorer, a shiv is a script that, when executed, forces the browser to recognize HTML5 elements.

]]>

component.name: ImageGallery
component.description:
• Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Displays an image in a Overlay
  • Displays list of thumbnails of the images as a control
  • Slide show functionalities (i.e., play, pause etc)
  • Keyboard navigation support
    • Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/image-viewer/gallery/).]]>

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: focusOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: fillHeightChange
event.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. event.name: focusOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

event.name: headerContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

component.name: LiveSearch
component.description:
A base class for LiveSearch, providing:
  • Real-time filtering for DOM elements based on a input query
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.LiveSearch({
	input: '#input',
	nodes: '#search .entry'
});
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for LiveSearch.]]>

attribute.description:
Function to extract the content from the node for the indexing. The default uses the node.html(). In case if you need to index the id of the nodes, here goes one example:

Example indexing the id of the node instead of the HTML: 
function(node) {
 return node.attr('id');
}

component.name: LoadingMask
component.description:
A base class for LoadingMask, providing:
  • Cross browser mask functionality to cover an element or the entire page
  • Customizable mask (i.e., background, opacity)
  • Display a centered "loading" message on the masked node
Quick Example:
node.plug(A.LoadingMask, { background: '#000' });
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for LoadingMask.]]>

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description:
Determine the content of Modal's body section.
Temporary fix for widget-stdmod bug when bodyContent initializes empty. this._currFillNode is never updated if _uiSetFillHeight is not called.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: destroyOnHideChange
event.description: Determine if Modal should be destroyed when hidden.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: draggableChange
event.description: Determine if Modal should be draggable or not.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: fillHeightChange
event.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: focusOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.

component.name: OverlayBase
component.description: <![CDATA[A basic Overlay Widget, which can be positioned based on Page XY co-ordinates and is stackable (z-index support). It also provides alignment and centering support and uses a standard module format for it's content, with header, body and footer section support.]]>

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:

* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->

If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

component.name: OverlayContext
component.description:
A base class for OverlayContext, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Able to display an Overlay at a specified corner of an element trigger
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.OverlayContext({
 boundingBox: '#OverlayBoundingBox',
 hideOn: 'mouseleave',
 showOn: 'mouseenter',
	trigger: '.menu-trigger'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayContext.]]>

component.name: OverlayContextPanel
component.description:
A base class for OverlayContextPanel, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Customizable arrow
  • Optional animation when show or hide
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.OverlayContextPanel({
 bodyContent: 'Here s a sample OverlayContextPanel.',
 boundingBox: '#overlay-context-panel',
 trigger: '#triggerButton',
 cancellableHide: true,
 hideDelay: 200,
 hideOnDocumentClick: false,
 anim: true
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayContextPanel.]]>

component.name: OverlayManager
component.description:
A base class for OverlayManager, providing:
  • Grouping overlays
  • Show or hide the entire group of registered overlays
  • Basic Overlay Stackability (zIndex support)
Quick Example:
var groupOverlayManager = new A.OverlayManager();
groupOverlayManager.register([overlay1, overlay2, overlay3]);
groupOverlayManager.hideAll();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayManager.]]>

component.name: OverlayMask
component.description:
• Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Cross browser mask functionality to cover an element or the entire page
  • Customizable mask (i.e., background, opacity)
    • Quick Example:
    var instance = new A.OverlayMask().render();
    Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for OverlayMask.]]>

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: Points to align the Overlay used as mask.
attribute.name: alignPoints

attribute.description: Background color of the mask.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: background

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: CSS opacity of the mask.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.5"}-->
attribute.name: opacity

attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: preventOverlap

attribute.description: Use shim option.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: shim

attribute.description: Node where the mask will be positioned and re-dimensioned. The default is the document, which means that if not specified the mask takes the full screen.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"document"}-->
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: If true the Overlay is visible by default after the render phase. Inherited from Overlay.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: Page X co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: Page XY co-ordinate pair for the widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: xy

attribute.description: Page Y co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: zIndex of the OverlayMask.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1000"}-->
attribute.name: zIndex

component.name: Pagination
component.description:
• Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Set of controls to navigate through paged data
    • Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/pagination/).]]>

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: When enabled this property allows the navigation to go back to the beggining when it reaches the last page, the opposite behavior is also true. Incremental page navigation could happen clicking the control arrows or invoking .next() and .prev() methods.
attribute.name: circular

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: A formatter function to format each pagination item.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: formatter

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: Holds the page items as a NodeList. The list could be queried from the DOM trough Widget HTML_PARSER or generated if total is specified.
attribute.name: items

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Initial page offset.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1"}-->
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: Page to display on initial paint.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: page

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Text used on Pagination.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Total number of page links available. If set, the new items node list will be rendered.
attribute.name: total

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width

event.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: renderChange
event.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: renderedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: selectedChange
event.description: Provides the index of currently selected item.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: srcNodeChange
event.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: stringsChange
event.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: toggleSelectionChange
event.description: If true, on user interaction if the user clicks on an already selected element, it will be unselected.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: visibleChange
event.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: widthChange
event.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: ParseContent
component.description:
• After plug ParseContent on a A.Node instance the javascript chunks will be executed (remote and inline scripts)
  • All the javascripts within a content will be executed according to the order of apparition

    • NOTE: For performance reasons on DOM manipulation, ParseContent only parses the content passed to the setContent, prepend and append methods.

    Quick Example:
    node.plug(A.Plugin.ParseContent);
    Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for ParseContent.]]>

component.name: Plugin.IO
component.description:
• Loads the content of a URI as content of a Node or Widget
  • Use ParseContent to parse the JavaScript tags from the content and evaluate them
    • Quick Example:
    A.one('#content').plug(A.Plugin.IO, { uri: 'assets/content.html', method: 'GET' });
    Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for IOPlugin.]]>

attribute.description: Whether the transaction is active or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: active

attribute.description: See IO Configuration.
attribute.name: arguments

attribute.description: If true invoke the start method automatically, initializing the IO transaction.
attribute.name: autoLoad

attribute.description: If false the current timestamp will be appended to the url, avoiding the url to be cached.

attribute.description: Object containing all the IO Configuration Attributes. This Object is passed to the A.io internally.

attribute.description: See IO Configuration.

attribute.description: See IO Configuration.

attribute.description: If true the ParseContent plugin will be plugged to the node.

attribute.description: This is a normalized attribute for the response data. It's useful to retrieve the correct type for the dataType (i.e., in json requests the responseData) is a JSONObject.

attribute.description: Where to insert the content, AFTER, BEFORE or REPLACE. If you're plugging a Node, there is a fourth option called OUTER that will not only replace the entire node itself. This is different from REPLACE, in that REPLACE will replace the *contents* of the node, OUTER will replace the entire Node itself.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: where

attribute.description: See IO Configuration.

component.name: Popover
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for Popover.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/popover/).]]>

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Returns a Y.Node instance of the node being used as the mask.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: maskNode

attribute.description: Whether the widget should be modal or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: modal

attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: preventOverlap

attribute.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether or not a shim should be added to the Widgets boundingBox, to protect it from select box bleedthrough.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: shim

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: toolbarPosition

attribute.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: toolbars

attribute.description: DOM event to hide the tooltip.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"click"}-->
attribute.name: triggerToggleEvent

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: Page X co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: x

attribute.description: Page XY co-ordinate pair for the widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: xy

attribute.description: Page Y co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: y

attribute.description: The z-index to apply to the Widgets boundingBox. Non-numerical values for zIndex will be converted to 0<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: zIndex

event.name: hideOnChange
event.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
