event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: ProgressBar
component.description:
• Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • A visual means of showing progress of an ongoing operation
  • Can be enhanced via CSS styles to provide different colors, shapes and textures
  • The bar can move horizontally or vertically
  • The movement can be enhanced by using the Animation utility
    • Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/progressbar/).]]>

Controls whether `addRow`, `removeRow`, and `modifyRow` should trigger the underlying Model's sync layer by default.
When `true`, it is unnecessary to pass the "sync" configuration property to those methods to trigger per-operation sync.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"`false`"}-->

attribute.description:
If the View class assigned to the DataTable's `view` attribute supports it, this class will be used for rendering the contents of the `<tbody>` including all data rows.
Similar to `view`, the instance of this View will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `body` property.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
The collection of data records to display. This attribute is a pass through to a `data` property, which is a ModelList instance.
If this attribute is passed a ModelList or subclass, it will be assigned to the property directly. If an array of objects is passed, a new ModelList will be created using the configured `recordType` as its `model` property and seeded with the array.
Retrieving this attribute will return the ModelList stored in the `data` property.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"`new ModelList()`"}-->

attribute.name: locale

attribute.description:
Model subclass to use as the `model` for the ModelList stored in the `data` attribute.
If not provided, it will try really hard to figure out what to use. The following attempts will be made to set a default value:
1. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance and its `model` property is set, that will be used. 2. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance, and its `model` property is unset, but it is populated, the `ATTRS` of the `constructor of the first item will be used. 3. If the `data` attribute is set with a non-empty array, a Model subclass will be generated using the keys of the first item as its `ATTRS` (see the `_createRecordClass` method). 4. If the `columns` attribute is set, a Model subclass will be generated using the columns defined with a `key`. This is least desirable because columns can be duplicated or nested in a way that's not parsable. 5. If neither `data` nor `columns` is set or populated, a change event subscriber will listen for the first to be changed and try all over again.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"(see description)"}-->
attribute.name: recordType

attribute.description:
Deprecated as of 3.5.0. Passes through to the `data` attribute.
WARNING: `get('recordset')` will NOT return a Recordset instance as of 3.5.0. This is a break in backward compatibility.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: recordset

attribute.description: Enables the display of messages in the table. Setting this to false will prevent the message Node from being created and `showMessage` from doing anything.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: showMessages

attribute.description:
The current sort configuration to maintain in the data.
Accepts column `key` strings or objects with a single property, the column `key`, with a value of 1, -1, "asc", or "desc". E.g. `{ username: 'asc' }`. String values are assumed to be ascending.
Example values would be:
* `"username"` - sort by the data's `username` field or the `key` associated to a column with that `name`. * `{ username: "desc" }` - sort by `username` in descending order. Alternately, use values "asc", 1 (same as "asc"), or -1 (same as "desc"). * `["lastName", "firstName"]` - ascending sort by `lastName`, but for records with the same `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Array can have as many items as you want. * `[{ lastName: -1 }, "firstName"]` - descending sort by `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Mixed types are ok.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: sortBy

attribute.description:
Controls which column headers can trigger sorting by user clicks.
Acceptable values are:
* "auto" - (default) looks for `sortable: true` in the column configurations * `true` - all columns are enabled * `false - no UI sortable is enabled * {String[]} - array of key names to give sortable headers<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"auto"}-->
attribute.name: sortable

attribute.name: summary

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description:
The View class used to render the `<table>` into the Widget's `contentBox`. This View can handle the entire table rendering itself or delegate to other Views.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.
When the DataTable is rendered, an instance of this View will be created and its `render()` method called. The View instance will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `view` property.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: view

event.name: autoSyncChange
event.description:
Controls whether `addRow`, `removeRow`, and `modifyRow` should trigger the underlying Model's sync layer by default.
When `true`, it is unnecessary to pass the "sync" configuration property to those methods to trigger per-operation sync.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyConfigChange
event.description: Configuration object passed to the class constructor in `bodyView` during render.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyViewChange
event.description:
If the View class assigned to the DataTable's `view` attribute supports it, this class will be used for rendering the contents of the `<tbody>` including all data rows.
Similar to `view`, the instance of this View will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `body` property.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.description: HTML content of an optional `<caption>` element to appear above the table. Leave this config unset or set to a falsy value to remove the caption.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: columnsChange

event.name: contentBoxChange
event.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: dataChange
event.description:
The collection of data records to display. This attribute is a pass through to a `data` property, which is a ModelList instance.
If this attribute is passed a ModelList or subclass, it will be assigned to the property directly. If an array of objects is passed, a new ModelList will be created using the configured `recordType` as its `model` property and seeded with the array.
Retrieving this attribute will return the ModelList stored in the `data` property.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: editEventChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: focusedChange

Similar to `view`, the instance of this View will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `foot` property.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

If the View class assigned to the DataTable's `view` attribute supports it, this class will be used for rendering the contents of the `<thead>`—the column headers for the table.
Similar to `view`, the instance of this View will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `head` property.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: recordTypeChange
event.description:
Model subclass to use as the `model` for the ModelList stored in the `data` attribute.
If not provided, it will try really hard to figure out what to use. The following attempts will be made to set a default value:
1. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance and its `model` property is set, that will be used. 2. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance, and its `model` property is unset, but it is populated, the `ATTRS` of the `constructor of the first item will be used. 3. If the `data` attribute is set with a non-empty array, a Model subclass will be generated using the keys of the first item as its `ATTRS` (see the `_createRecordClass` method). 4. If the `columns` attribute is set, a Model subclass will be generated using the columns defined with a `key`. This is least desirable because columns can be duplicated or nested in a way that's not parsable. 5. If neither `data` nor `columns` is set or populated, a change event subscriber will listen for the first to be changed and try all over again.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: recordsetChange
event.description:
Deprecated as of 3.5.0. Passes through to the `data` attribute.
WARNING: `get('recordset')` will NOT return a Recordset instance as of 3.5.0. This is a break in backward compatibility.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: renderChange
event.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: renderedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: scrollableChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: showMessagesChange
event.description: Enables the display of messages in the table. Setting this to false will prevent the message Node from being created and `showMessage` from doing anything.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: sortByChange
event.description:
The current sort configuration to maintain in the data.
Accepts column `key` strings or objects with a single property, the column `key`, with a value of 1, -1, "asc", or "desc". E.g. `{ username: 'asc' }`. String values are assumed to be ascending.
Example values would be:
* `"username"` - sort by the data's `username` field or the `key` associated to a column with that `name`. * `{ username: "desc" }` - sort by `username` in descending order. Alternately, use values "asc", 1 (same as "asc"), or -1 (same as "desc"). * `["lastName", "firstName"]` - ascending sort by `lastName`, but for records with the same `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Array can have as many items as you want. * `[{ lastName: -1 }, "firstName"]` - descending sort by `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Mixed types are ok.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: sortableChange
event.description:
Controls which column headers can trigger sorting by user clicks.
Acceptable values are:
* "auto" - (default) looks for `sortable: true` in the column configurations * `true` - all columns are enabled * `false - no UI sortable is enabled * {String[]} - array of key names to give sortable headers<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: srcNodeChange
event.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: stringsChange
event.description: TODO. Wanna help? Please send a Pull Request.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.description: Content for the `<table summary="ATTRIBUTE VALUE HERE">`. Values assigned to this attribute will be HTML escaped for security.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: viewChange
event.description:
The View class used to render the `<table>` into the Widget's `contentBox`. This View can handle the entire table rendering itself or delegate to other Views.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.
When the DataTable is rendered, an instance of this View will be created and its `render()` method called. The View instance will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `view` property.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: Resize
component.description:
A base class for Resize, providing:
  • Basic Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Applies drag handles to an element to make it resizable
  • Here is the list of valid resize handles: [ 't', 'tr', 'r', 'br', 'b', 'bl', 'l', 'tl' ]. You can read this list as top, top-right, right, bottom-right, bottom, bottom-left, left, top-left.
  • The drag handles are inserted into the element and positioned absolute. Some elements, such as a textarea or image, don't support children. To overcome that, set wrap:true in your config and the element willbe wrapped for you automatically.
Quick Example: 
var instance = new A.Resize({
 node: '#resize1',
 proxy: true,
 preserveRatio: true,
 wrap: true,
 maxHeight: 170,
 maxWidth: 400,
 handles: 't, tr, r, br, b, bl, l, tl'
});
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Resize.]]>

attribute.description: Stores the active handle during the resize.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description: The selector or element to resize. Required.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: node

attribute.description: Resize a proxy element instead of the real element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: proxy

attribute.description: The Resize proxy element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: proxyEl

attribute.description: True when the element is being Resized.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: resizing

attribute.description: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false) in favor of the handles config option. The wrapper element type (default div) could be over-riden passing the wrapper attribute.
attribute.name: wrap

attribute.description: Elements that requires a wrapper by default. Normally are elements which cannot have children elements.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"/canvas|textarea|input|select|button|img/i"}-->
attribute.name: wrapTypes

attribute.description: Element to wrap the wrapTypes. This element will house the handles elements.
attribute.name: wrapper

event.name: activeHandleChange
event.description: Stores the active handle during the resize.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: activeHandleElChange
event.description: Stores the active handle element during the resize.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: activeHandleNodeChange
event.description: Stores the active handle element during the resize.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: autoHideChange
event.description: False to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, true to display them only when the user mouses over the resizable borders.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.description: The default minimum width of the element. Only used when ResizeConstrained is not plugged.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

A client-only identifier for this model.

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: stacked

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Determine the type of tabs.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"tabs"}-->

attribute.name: width

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

event.name: alignChange
event.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: alignOnChange
event.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: bodyContentChange
event.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

event.name: boundingBoxChange
event.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: centeredChange
event.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: constrainChange
event.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: contentBoxChange

attribute.description: Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the user is requesting them.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: alwaysShowContainer

attribute.description: If set to true, the filterResults method will be run on the response from the data source.
attribute.name: applyLocalFilter

attribute.description: Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are made visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: autoHighlight

attribute.description: To use a button<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: button

attribute.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.
attribute.name: dataSource

attribute.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.
attribute.name: dataSourceType

attribute.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: delimChar

attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.
attribute.name: forceSelection

attribute.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: input

attribute.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->
attribute.name: matchKey

attribute.description: The maximum number of results to display.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"10"}-->
attribute.name: maxResultsDisplayed

attribute.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"1"}-->
attribute.name: minQueryLength

attribute.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.2"}-->
attribute.name: queryDelay

attribute.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.5"}-->
attribute.name: queryInterval

attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.
attribute.name: queryMatchCase

attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.
attribute.name: queryMatchContains

attribute.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.
attribute.name: queryQuestionMark

attribute.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.
attribute.name: schema

attribute.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.
attribute.name: schemaType

attribute.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: suppressInputUpdate

attribute.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.
attribute.name: typeAhead

attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.
attribute.name: typeAheadDelay

attribute.description: The unique ID of the input element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: uniqueName

component.name: ThumbRating
component.description:
• A non-obstrusive star rating control using Thumb up and Thumb down icons
  • Could be based on a set of radio input boxes
    • Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/rating/).]]>

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: If true could be reseted (i.e., have no values selected).
attribute.name: canReset

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: CSS classes applied on ThumbRating.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: cssClasses

attribute.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"0"}-->

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow hover or click, just display selected stars.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: NodeList of elements used on the Rating. Each element is one Star.
attribute.name: elements

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input replace the radio elements and keep the same name.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: hiddenInput

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.
attribute.name: inputName

attribute.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.
attribute.name: labelNode

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Stores the index of the selected element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"-1"}-->
attribute.name: selectedIndex

attribute.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.
attribute.name: showTitle

attribute.description: The size on ThumbRating is always 2 (i.e., thumb up and thumb down).<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"2"}-->
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.

attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Stores the value of the current selected Rating element.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

event.description: CSS classes applied on ThumbRating.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: defaultSelectedChange
event.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: destroyedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: disabledChange
event.description: Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow hover or click, just display selected stars.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: elementsChange
event.description: NodeList of elements used on the Rating. Each element is one Star.

event.name: focusedChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: heightChange
event.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: hiddenInputChange
event.description: Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input replace the radio elements and keep the same name.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: hideClassChange
event.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

event.name: idChange
event.description: <!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: initializedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: inputNameChange
event.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.

event.name: labelChange
event.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: labelNodeChange
event.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.

event.name: localeChange
event.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: renderChange
event.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

event.name: renderedChange
event.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: selectedIndexChange
event.description: Stores the index of the selected element.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: showTitleChange
event.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.

event.name: sizeChange
event.description: The size on ThumbRating is always 2 (i.e., thumb up and thumb down).<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: srcNodeChange
event.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: stringsChange
event.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: titleChange
event.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.

event.name: useARIAChange
event.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: valueChange
event.description: Stores the value of the current selected Rating element.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: visibleChange
event.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

event.name: widthChange
event.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description: Determine if the Toggler transitions will animate.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

event.name: tabIndexChange
event.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":true,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

component.name: ToolbarRenderer
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for ToolbarRenderer.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/toolbar/).]]>

component.name: Tooltip
component.description:
A base class for Tooltip, providing:
  • Widget Lifecycle (initializer, renderUI, bindUI, syncUI, destructor)
  • Additional information when hovering over a target element
Quick Example:
var instance = new A.Tooltip({
	trigger: '#element',
	align: { points: [ 'lc', 'rc' ] },
	bodyContent: 'Simple tooltip'
}).render();
Check the list of Configuration Attributes available for Tooltip.]]>

attribute.description: See OverlayContextPanel align.
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: See OverlayContextPanel anim.
attribute.name: anim

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: bodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

component.name: Video
component.description:
<![CDATA[A base class for Video.
Check the [live demo](http://alloyui.com/examples/video/).]]>

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: An additional list of attributes.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: fixedAttributes

attribute.description: Variables used by Flash player.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: flashVars

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: <!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: URL (on .ogv format) used by Video to play.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: ogvUrl

attribute.description: Image displayed before playback starts.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: poster

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be automatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: URL (on .swf format) used by Video to create a fallback player with Flash.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: swfUrl

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: URL used by Video to play.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width
